result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Adam Thomas Cesarz was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam Thomas Cesarz is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Adam Thomas Cesarz was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Adam Thomas Cesarz was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
07-06-2016/ Judge Dennis R Cimpl
The Court ordered the DNA surcharge, ON COUNT TWO, is vacated.
** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** ** 

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter. 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with:
 the victims as specified in the Complaint.

Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- No driving without a valid driver's license.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 2 years with the mandatory reinstatement fee.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense.  Additional statements by: Thomas C. and Sarah H.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but is eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.


  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: the victims as specified in the Complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- No driving without a valid driver's license.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter. 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored. 

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 2 years with the mandatory reinstatement fee.

[Same appearances] Juror question placed on the record.
At the hour of 1:24pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3 (for purpose of jury trial, this was referred to as Count 2) and GUILTY as to Count 1 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict on Count 1 and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction and acquittal of Count 3.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22 on April 16, 2015 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
At the hour of 9:22am jury back in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:15am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Klatkiewicz and Hadfield who were duly sworn for that purpose.   Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.

Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Parties stipulate to the qualifications of the expert witness.  Jury in box at 1:45 pm.  Sworn for the State: Margaret Cairo, MPD Officer Richard Schnier.  Exhibits 30-67, 71, 72, 74, 75 received into evidence.  Jury out of box at 2:49 pm.  Sidebars placed on the record.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.  Jury in the box at 3:05 pm.  Sworn for defense: Sarah H.  Jury out of box at 3:44 pm.  Jury back in box at 3:50 pm.  Sworn for defense:  Adam Cesarz.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: MPD Officer Richard Schnier, MPD Detective Jason Dorava.  State and defense rest.  Court releases jurors for the evening. Jury out of box at 4:42.  Case adjourned to Branch 22.  Jury trial scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Discussion regarding pretrial issues held.  Trial proceeded.  Jury in box at 9:32 am.  Sworn for the state:  Dale W., Jayme F.  Jury out of box at 10:05 am.  Sidebars place on the record.  Sworn for the court out of the presence of the jury:  Thomas C.  Jury back in box at 10:23 am.  Continued testimony of Jayme F.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Detective Jason Dorava, Thomas C. Jury out of box at 10:49 am.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Out of the presence of the jury: continued testimony of Thomas C.  Jury back in box at 11:15 am.  Continued testimony of Thomas C.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Officer Christopher Bruns.  Court releases jury for the lunch hour.  Jury out of box at 11:57 am.  Exhibits 9, 10, 13-29 moved in to evidence.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Case adjourned to 1:30 pm.

Motions in Limine discussed.  For the purpose of Jury Trial only Count 3 will be referred to as Count 2.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:16pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Jury panel out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  

Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officers Brian Heder and Victor Murilo & Citizen Devon W.

Exhibits 11, 12, 1-8 received.  

At the hour of 4:43pm the jury was dismissed for the evening, but ordered to return 03/03/2015 at 9:00am.  Jury out box.  Sidebars placed on the record.

Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also in court, student Intern Mike Kessler under the supervision of Francesco Mineo.
Case in court for Jury Trial.  Parties have entered into agreement on Counts 2 & 4.  Pursuant to negotiations, Count 4 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 2:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case will proceed to Jury Trial in regards to Counts 1 & 3.  Jury trial scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for jury trial, however Branch 22 will be in speedy jury trial with another case. 
*After case was called speedy jury trial resolved and this trial was put back on the calendar for today at 1:30pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Witness list - plaintiff received and filed.
Defense Motion in limine received and filed.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz not in court, in custody.  Thomas Potter for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 03/02/2015 at 9:00am.  State rescinded their offer.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND due 03/03/2015.

Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS the State's request for adjourned Jury Trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

  Jury trial scheduled for 09-22-2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Richard L Voss in court, defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Richard L Voss has accepted appointment as counsel for the defense.  Attorney Voss informs Court off the record that his client is currently housed in the Racine County Jail.  Pretrial Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-09-2014 at 08:30 am.
From Attorney Richard Voss, dated 05-07-2014, regarding Discovery Demand, FILED.

Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Richard L Voss.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Thomas Potter for Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of the addition of the word "not" on page 3.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
-Scanned; ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Defendant Adam Thomas Cesarz in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 4.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
